Kralupy nad Vltavou is a satellite town 25 km north of

. A visit makes for an interesting break from the capital to see what life is like away from the main city. The town is divided by the river. The western half hosts the station and older central area and the eastern half has many high-rise apartment blocks.

value: A well kept communist building, the main railway station.

Regional trains regularly run the scenic 25 km along the Vltava River from central Prague's Masarykovo station (30 min, 43 Kƒç).
The town is small and easily explored on foot.
The river in town is scenic.
Pubs and restaurants are much cheaper than in the city, tourist-free and convivial.
There are a couple of hotels if a day trip doesn't suffice.
